Location Base: Tseung Kwan O and occasionally at various Immigration offices, data centres and control points
Project Nature: "(T26) Computer project implementation, including system enhancement and related system support relating to the record management business of the Immigration Department (ImmD)."
Duties: "- Serve a contract assignment under InfoTech's headcount, full-time second to serve the ImmD; ;The CSA shall be responsible for providing IT support and advice for the implementation of systems enhancements relating to the record management business of the ImmD. The CSA shall also assist in related site preparation and system configuration and deployment.;;The key duties are as follows:;(a) to perform implementation and enhancements support including installation of computer systems, assessment and implementation of application and system patches, system implementation and testing as well as system nursing and maintenance;;(b) to study, assess and recommend cost-effective technical solution for new business initiatives;;(c) to collaborate with related stakeholders from both business and technical aspects and provide technical support for enhancements;;(d) to review contractors' deliverables for compliance with required standards and guidelines, and monitor the performance of contractors and his/her subordinates; ;(e) to execute and ensure the proper system change and configuration management; and;(f) to perform any other duties as may be required. ;"
Requirements: "The CSA shall be able to work independently, and shall possess strong analytical, system design and implementation skills. The CSA shall have good experience in technical support and advisory on IT applications and security. Good knowledge on both online and batch application development and processing are required. Round-the-clock (24x7) on-call technical support to the system is required. The CSA may be required to work occasionally outside normal office hours to carry out the duties. ;;Criminal record check is required. ;Technical Skills: ;. At least 3 years' experience in JAVA Programming (JAV); ;. At least 2 years' experience in batch job monitoring (BJM); ;. At least 2 years' experience in IT Security (ITS). ;Non-technical Skills: ;. At least 1 year's experience in the management and support of Government systems and services (GSS); ;. At least 1 year's experience in vendor management (VMG). ;- Bachelor's degree/Higher Diploma in Computer Science, IT or equivalent; ;- At least 4 years' post-qualification experience in which at least 1 year's relevant experience in a similar post and in a comparable capacity."

Location Base: Tseung Kwan O and occasionally support at various immigration offices and data centres
Project Nature: "(T26) To provide and manage enhancement and related maintenance support for infrastructure implementation, support the computer equipment relocation exercise to the New Immigration Headquarters relating to network, system and database as well as managing the contractors for Next Generation Application and Investigation Easy Systems (APPLIES-2), relating to Visa and Permit, Birth, Death and Marriage Registration of the Immigration Department (ImmD)."
Duties: "- Serve a contract assignment under InfoTech's headcount, full-time second to serve the ImmD; ;The CSSA is responsible for providing and managing system enhancement, computer equipment relocation exercise and related maintenance, advice for the mission-critical computer projects on network, system, storage, site-preparation and infrastructure support.;;The key duties are as follows:;(a) To perform quality control and assurance on system enhancement, equipment relocation tasks, and related maintenance, site-preparation and project management duties as designated by the project manager;;(b) To oversee all phases of system enhancement including SA&D, development, implementation, site-preparation, installation of equipment, system testing, production rollout, system nursing and maintenance;;(d) To provide professional advice and assess technical solutions;;(e) To coordinate with related stakeholders from both business and technical aspects and provide technical support for system enhancements/computer projects;;(f) To provide quality assurance on project deliverables and monitor performance of contractors and his/her subordinates;;(g) To execute and guarantee the proper change management; and;(h) To perform any other duties as may be required. ;"
Requirements: "(i) Solid experiences in technical support and advisory on IT infrastructure of mission-critical systems;;(ii) Solid knowledge on document management system, network & backup infrastructure and database management;;(iii) Solid project and vendor management and coordination skills;;(iv) Self-motivated and strong ability to work independently; and;(v) Criminal record check is required. ;Technical Skills: ;. At least 4 years' experience in IBM AIX Administration (IAA); ;. At least 4 years' experience in Infrastructure (INF); ;. At least 4 years' experience in Production Database Support (PDS); ;. At least 4 years' experience in Tivoli Workload Scheduler (TWS). ;Non-technical Skill: ;. At least 2 years' experience in the management and support of Government systems and services (GSS). ;- Bachelor's degree/Higher Diploma in Computer Science, IT or equivalent; ;- At least 6 years' post-qualification experience in which at least 2 years' relevant experience in a similar post and in a comparable capacity."

Project Nature: "(T26) Provide technical support and helpdesk services for the ""Knowing More About IT"" in Primary Schools Programme"
Duties: "- Serve a contract assignment under InfoTech's headcount, full-time second to serve the DPO; ;The main job duties are as follows:;- Answer both technical and general queries from schools, provide helpdesk support and professional advices to schools to assist them in organising and conducting IT related extra-curricular activities (ECAs), such as activity design, procurement of hardware, software, cloud services and training courses, etc.;- Coordinate with schools and provide assistance to them in the pre-application vetting and submitting funding applications using e-forms.;- Process and compile statistics from submitted funding applications from schools.;- Coordinate inter-schools ECAs, conduct school surveys, support promotion activities, and pay visits to schools if necessary.;- Conduct research/study and evaluate hardware/software/professional services related to the organisation of IT-related ECAs in schools.;- Any other duties assigned by the supervisors.;- In addition, he/she may be required to work in non-office hours on need basis. ;"
Requirements: "- Sound experience in providing customer supports, helpdesk supports and consultancy services.;- Experience in handling of funding application of government funding schemes is preferable.;- Experience in providing operation support to systems which are using government e-Form and integrated with the government authentication and signing system is preferable.;- Rich knowledge of information technology (including cyber security).;- Proficiency on spreadsheet operation and generation of data analysis reports. ;- Experience in web programming, e.g. PHP, JavaScript, etc.;- Good knowledge of emerging technologies (such as artificial intelligence, cloud services, big data, Internet of Things, augmented reality, virtual reality, etc.) is preferable.;- Experience in organising events (such as exhibition, seminar, etc.) and providing event support is preferable.;- Good command of written and spoken Chinese and English.;- Good communication and interpersonal skills. ;Technical Skills: ;. At least 6 months' experience in PHP programming (PHP); ;. 1 year's experience in System Implementation and Maintenance/Support (SIM) is an advantage; ;. 1 year's experience in IT Application Development and Management (ADM) is an advantage; ;. 1 year's experience in Electronic Form (EFM) is an advantage; ;. 6 months' experience in JavaScript Programming (JAP) is an advantage; ;. 6 months' experience in Web Programming (WEB) is an advantage. ;Non-technical Skills: ;. At least 1 year's experience in customer service (CLS); ;. At least 1 year's experience in customer relations (ECR); ;. At least 1 year's experience in helpdesk call handling (HDT); ;. Good spoken English is a must; ;. 1 year's experience in managing Government projects (MGP) is an advantage; ;. Good written English is an advantage; ;. 1 year's experience in IT advisory and promotion, e.g. exhibition, publication (APR) is an advantage; ;. 1 year's experience in IT in the community e.g. promote the use of IT/IT awareness (ITC) is an advantage; ;. 1 year's experience in work with the Government (GOV) is an advantage. ;- Bachelor's degree/Higher Diploma in Computer Science, IT or equivalent; ;- At least 4 years' post-qualification experience in which at least 1 year's relevant experience in a similar post and in a comparable capacity."

Project Nature: "(T26) 1. Lead, participate, monitor and support in digital transformation in EMSD with leading-edge technologies, including Agentic AI Projects, Semantic AI Development Projects, Integrated Building Management Projects, and Energy Saving Projects, and mission critical tasks such as awards / event racings and exhibition works. ;2. Lead and participate in feasibility studies, user requirements gathering, and the design and development, testing and documentation of application systems. This includes interfacing with integrated Building Management System (iBMS) and other information systems to collect, process, and analyze building operational data, aimed at facilitating further optimization of building systems and conducting in-depth data analysis.;3. Lead and participate in the design and development of APIs for integration with a centralized data repository and other information systems. This involves ensuring the efficient storage, processing, and analysis of collected data, supporting"
Duties: "- Serve a contract assignment under InfoTech's headcount, full-time second to serve the E&MSD; ;1. Conduct user requirements gathering, system analysis, design applications. Lead and perform coding, testing and deployment of application programs, leveraging cutting-edge AI technologies, particularly Large Language Models (LLMs), machine learning, and emerging AI solutions;;2. To undertake any other duties as required by supervisor(s). ;"

Experience in web application development, RESTful API design, and development and integration;;4. Proven ability to conduct thorough feasibility studies, user requirements gathering, and system analysis & design;;5. Solid experience in SQL and NoSQL databases management (MongoDB, MS SQL, and MySQL);;6. Basic machine learning concepts, and statistical analysis skills is a plus;;7. Good hands on knowledge in Windows, Linux or other operating system(s) is a definite advantage;;8. Good troubleshooting and debugging skills;;9. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills;;10. Good technical documentation and communication skills;;11. Ability to quickly adapt and learn new technologies and systems;;12. Self-motivated with ability to work in a collaborative environment;;13. Creative, self-initiative, responsible, well-organized, and work independently on complex tasks. ;Technical Skills: ;. At least 4 years' experience in IT Application Development and Management (ADM); ;. At least 4 years' experience in Data Modeling (DMO); ;. At least 4 years' experience in Data Management (DMT); ;. At least 3 years' experience in JavaScript Programming (JAP); ;. At least 3 years' experience in JAVA Programming (JAV); ;. At least 3 years' experience in MySQL (MSQ); ;. At least 2 years' experience in Microsoft SQL Server (MSS); ;. 3 years' experience in HTML version before HTML5 (HTM) is an advantage; ;. 3 years' experience in Apache Web Server (AWS) is an advantage; ;. 3 years' experience in batch job monitoring (BJM) is an advantage; ;. 2 years' experience in PHP programming (PHP) is an advantage. ;Non-technical Skills: ;. At least 3 years' experience in work with the Government (GOV); ;. At least 3 years' experience in IT Service Management (SMG); ;. At least 3 years' experience in software testing (STM); ;. At least 3 years' experience in vendor management (VMG); ;. Good coordination skills is an advantage. ;- Bachelor's degree/Higher Diploma in Computer Science, IT or equivalent; ;- At least 4 years' post-qualification experience in which at least 2 years' relevant experience in a similar post and in a comparable capacity."

Location Base: Tseung Kwan O and occasionally at various Immigration offices, data centres and control points
Project Nature: "(T26) Computer project support and implementation, including support for the implementation for the Next Generation Immigration Enquiry Services System (IESS-2) and system support of Document Management Sub-system (Administration) (DMS(Adm)) of the Immigration Department (ImmD)."
Duties: "- Serve a contract assignment under InfoTech's headcount, full-time second to serve the ImmD; ;The CSA shall be responsible for providing IT support and advice for the system support and system enhancement relating to document management and system implementation relating to the systems integration, enquiry services and call centre application development and other operation and supporting services for handling enquiry requests for the IESS-2. The CSA shall also assist in related site preparation, system design, system testing and production roll out.;;The key duties are as follows:;(a) to perform the system support and enhancements support including assessment and implementation of application related to document management, enquiry services and call centre related operation, etc;;(b) to evaluate the most appropriate and cost-effective technical solution for the implementation and enhancements related to document management, enquiry services and call centre related operation, etc;;(c) to collaborate with related stakeholders from both business and technical aspects and provide technical support for system implementation;;(d) to monitor and examine contractor's work and performance of contractors and his/her subordinates through examination of program source codes, perform database enquiry to verify the business logic and ensure version controls, etc.;(e) to execute and assure the proper change management related to document management, enquiry services and call centre related operation, etc; ;(f) to support and monitor resilience test and load test; and ;(g) to perform any other duties as may be required. ;"
Requirements: "The CSA shall be able to work independently, and shall possess strong analytical, system design, programming and testing skills. The CSA shall have good experience in technical support and advisory on call centre application as well as system implementation and enhancements. Good knowledge on call centre related application development. The CSA may be required to work occasionally outside normal office hours to carry out the duties. ;;Criminal record check is required. ;Technical Skills: ;. At least 2 years' experience in Java Application Framework (e.g. Struts (Apache)) (JAF); ;. At least 2 years' experience in Web Services (WSV); ;. At least 6 months' experience in SQL Server Reporting Services (SRS). ;Non-technical Skills: ;. At least 1 year's experience in the management and support of Government systems and services (GSS); ;. At least 1 year's experience in vendor management (VMG). ;- Bachelor's degree/Higher Diploma in Computer Science, IT or equivalent; ;- At least 4 years' post-qualification experience in which at least 1 year's relevant experience in a similar post and in a comparable capacity."
